text: Keith White (born 27 August 1958)Oakes, P & Rising, P (1986). 1986 Speedway Yearbook. is a former international speedway rider in the United Kingdom, who represented England at test level. His father Vic White rode and was often Keith's team manager throughout his career. ==Career== White started his career with the Peterborough Panthers in the National League but started to show his promise whilst at the Crewe Kings. His form prompted the Leicester Lions to call on his services up in the British League. He was then signed on a full contract by the Hackney Hawks to ride full-time in the top flight in 1976.Fenn, C.(2003). Hackney Speedway, Friday at Eight. After four seasons with Hackney, in the last of which he won the London Riders' Championship,Belton, Brian (2003). Hammerin' Round. Stroud: Tempus Publishing he moved on to the Coventry Bees as well as riding for the Milton Keynes Knights in the National League. He retired in 1990 after a poor start to the season (due to injuries) with the Long Eaton Invaders.Oakes, P (1991). 1991 Speedway Yearbook. ==References== Category:1958 births Category:Living people Category:British speedway riders Category:English motorcycle racers Category:Sportspeople from Chelmsford Category:Peterborough Panthers riders Category:Crewe Kings riders Category:Leicester Lions riders Category:Long Eaton Invaders riders Category:Hackney Hawks riders Category:Coventry Bees riders Category:Birmingham Brummies riders Category:Milton Keynes Knights riders Category:Poole Pirates riders Category:People from Hackney Central
title: Keith White (speedway rider)
